chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,
items.plainText: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,

items.text: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.
items.plainText: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

items.text: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
items.plainText: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

items.text: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.
items.plainText: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

items.text: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.
items.plainText: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

items.text: Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
items.plainText: Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

items.text: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
items.plainText: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

items.text: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?
items.plainText: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

items.text: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
items.plainText: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

items.text: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
items.plainText: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

items.text: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.
items.plainText: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

items.text: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
items.plainText: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

items.text: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.
items.plainText: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

items.text: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.
items.plainText: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

items.text: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
items.plainText: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

items.text: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
items.plainText: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

items.text: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
items.plainText: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

items.text: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
items.plainText: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

items.text: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.
items.plainText: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.

items.text: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
items.plainText: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

items.text: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
items.plainText: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

items.text: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
items.plainText: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

items.text: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.
items.plainText: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

items.text: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
items.plainText: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
